when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone during the day.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with someone.
example: はい、分かりました。 (hai, wakarimashita) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to politely decline or negate.
example: いいえ、大丈夫です。 (iie, daijoubu desu) - No, it’s okay.

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはよう、今日も頑張りましょう！ (ohayou, kyou mo ganbarimashou!) - Good morning, let's do our best today!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the evening.
example: こんばんは、遅くまでお疲れ様です。 (konbanwa, osoku made otsukaresama desu) - Good evening, thank you for working late.

when_to_say: Used to bid someone good night before sleeping.
example: おやすみなさい、また明日！ (oyasuminasai, mata ashita!) - Good night, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used in response to someone thanking you.
example: どういたしまして、お役に立てて嬉しいです。 (douitashimashite, oyaku ni tatete ureshii desu) - You’re welcome, I’m glad I could help.

word: よろしくお願いします
meaning: please take care of me / nice to meet you
when_to_say: Used when asking for kindness or during introductions.
example: 初めまして、よろしくお願いします。 (hajimemashite, yoroshiku onegaishimasu) - Nice to meet you, please take care of me.

when_to_say: Used to refer to educational institutions.
example: 私は毎日学校に行きます。 (watashi wa mainichi gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school every day.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to teachers or instructors.
example: 先生に質問があります。 (sensei ni shitsumon ga arimasu) - I have a question for the teacher.

when_to_say: Used to talk about or refer to friends.
example: 友達と公園で遊びます。 (tomodachi to kouen de asobimasu) - I play in the park with my friends.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of eating.
example: 毎朝パンを食べます。 (mai asa pan o tabemasu) - I eat bread every morning.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of drinking.
example: コーヒーを飲みますか？ (koohii o nomimasu ka?) - Do you drink coffee?

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or time.
example: 今日は学校に早く着きました。 (kyou wa gakkou ni hayaku tsukimashita) - I arrived at school early today.

when_to_say: Used to describe large objects or size.
example: 大きい家に住みたいです。 (ookii ie ni sumitai desu) - I want to live in a big house.

when_to_say: Used to describe small objects or size.
example: 小さい犬が好きです。 (chiisai inu ga suki desu) - I like small dogs.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of reading.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of writing.
example: 毎日日記を書きます。 (mainichi nikki o kakimasu) - I write in my diary every day.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color blue.
example: 空が青いです。 (sora ga aoi desu) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color red.
example: 赤い花を買いました。 (akai hana o kaimashita) - I bought a red flower.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is new.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is old.
example: この家はとても古いです。 (kono ie wa totemo furui desu) - This house is very old.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 今日は寒いですね。 (kyou wa samui desu ne) - It’s cold today, isn’t it?

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable.
example: 昨日のパーティーは楽しかったです。 (kinou no paatii wa tanoshikatta desu) - Yesterday’s party was fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe feeling tired.
example: 今日は仕事で疲れました。 (kyou wa shigoto de tsukaremashita) - I’m tired from work today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something interesting or amusing.
example: その映画は面白かったです。 (sono eiga wa omoshirokatta desu) - That movie was interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe food that tastes good.
example: このケーキは美味しいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of going somewhere.
example: 私は駅に行きます。 (watashi wa eki ni ikimasu) - I’m going to the station.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of coming.
example: 明日、友達が家に来ます。 (ashita, tomodachi ga ie ni kimasu) - Tomorrow, my friend is coming to my house.

when_to_say: Used to describe returning home or to a place.
example: 仕事が終わったら帰ります。 (shigoto ga owattara kaerimasu) - I’ll return home after work.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of seeing or looking at something.
example: テレビを見ます。 (terebi o mimasu) - I watch TV.

when_to_say: Used to describe asking or listening.
example: 先生に質問を聞きました。 (sensei ni shitsumon o kikimashita) - I asked the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used to describe creating or making something.
example: 晩ご飯を作ります。 (bangohan o tsukurimasu) - I will make dinner.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of studying.
example: 毎日勉強します。 (mainichi benkyou shimasu) - I study every day.

when_to_say: Used to describe taking a break or resting.
example: 今日は仕事を休みます。 (kyou wa shigoto o yasumimasu) - I’m taking a break from work today.

when_to_say: Used to describe walking.
example: 公園を歩きます。 (kouen o arukimasu) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used to describe playing or having fun.
example: 友達と一緒に遊びます。 (tomodachi to issho ni asobimasu) - I play with my friends.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of reading.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of teaching.
example: 先生は日本語を教えます。 (sensei wa nihongo o oshiemasu) - The teacher teaches Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to describe purchasing something.
example: 新しいカメラを買いました。 (atarashii kamera o kaimashita) - I bought a new camera.

when_to_say: Used to describe selling something.
example: 店でお土産を売っています。 (mise de omiyage o utteimasu) - They are selling souvenirs at the store.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of meeting someone.
example: 明日、友達に会います。 (ashita, tomodachi ni aimasu) - I will meet my friend tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to express not knowing something or someone.
example: その情報は知らないです。 (sono jouhou wa shiranai desu) - I don't know that information.

when_to_say: Used to describe feeling well or energetic.
example: 今日は元気です。 (kyou wa genki desu) - I feel energetic today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something large in size.
example: この建物は大きいです。 (kono tatemono wa ookii desu) - This building is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small in size.
example: この箱は小さいです。 (kono hako wa chiisai desu) - This box is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe something expensive or high in price.
example: この時計は高いです。 (kono tokei wa takai desu) - This watch is expensive.
